page.title: 04LEOMINSTER OPEN MARKET
page.content: {Leominster's}Corn Square begins to buzz with sound early on Friday morning. Caravans and canvas are used to protect the goods on sale which range from fresh items like fish, cheese, meats, vegetables and eggs to sweets,clothing, material, bedding, sheepskin rugs, plants, sunglasses, belts and sandals. The traders come from Gloucester, Wolverhampton, Cheltenham, Ross, Tewkesbury and Stourport. The first customers arrive with empty baskets, and the murmur of business rises to a babble as the Corn Square becomes a teeming queuing mass of people. For some customers this shopping trip is a weekly one made by bus from outlying villages - an opportunity to meet friends and relations. Is this scene much changed since the Domesday Book of 1086?
